definition: same as 渤海[Bo2 Hai3], Bohai Sea between Liaoning and Shandong/Gulf of Zhili or Chihli
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
Bohai Sea, or Bo Hai, between Liaoning and Shandong/Parhae, Korean kingdom in Manchuria and Siberia 698-926
lit. blue seas where once was mulberry fields (idiom, from 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], Record of the Grand Historian); time brings great changes/life's vicissitudes
Bohai Economic Rim (economic region including Beijing, Tianjin, Hebei, Liaoning and Shandong)
pinyin: Huan2 Bo2 hai3 Wan1 Di4 qu1

sentences.english: Xingcheng Bohai Sea is the ancient city is also a newly developed tourist resort.
sentences.chinese: 興城是渤海之濱的古城，亦是新開發的旅遊療養勝地。

sentences.english: Height near the ground in winter to the north-west flow mainly through the Beijing-Tianjin Bohai.
sentences.chinese: 冬季近地面高度上以西北氣流爲主，貫穿整個京津渤。

definition: hypo (loanword)/sodium thiosulfate Na2S2O3 used in fixing photos (formerly hyposulfite)/wave (sea)
bow case or scabbard/to hide/military strategy
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
navy (archaic)/person employed to post messages on the Internet (abbr. for 網絡水軍|网络水军[Wang3 luo4 shui3 jun1])
short name for Liaoning 遼寧|辽宁[Liao2 ning2] province/Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125)
Mt Tai in Shandong/same as 泰山
Campbell (name)/Kampar, town in the state of Perak, Malaysia
